intro: Daviesia condensata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sickle-pea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for native pollinators. Daviesia condensata is often found in open woodlands and shrublands, thriving in full sun.
